references.paper_title: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision
references.reason: This is a fundamental text in computer vision that provides the mathematical framework for multi-view geometry, essential for understanding 3D reconstruction and camera pose estimation.
This paper introduced the Transformer architecture, which is the foundation for the VGGT model used in the paper.
This paper serves as an important reference because it presents a robust and accurate approach to structure-from-motion which is essential to the work done in this paper.

references.paper_title: Tap-Vid: A benchmark for tracking any point in a video
references.reason: This paper introduces a widely used benchmark for dynamic point tracking, one of the key tasks evaluated in the presented paper.

references.paper_title: VGGSfM: visual geometry grounded deep structure from motion
references.reason: VGGSfM is state of the art in structure from motion and serves as a baseline in the current paper.
